item.description:
The Dixie Chicks, "the darlings of country music", and fine musicians to boot, were on tops of the charts, performing at sold-out arenas, when the lead singer blurted out during a 2003 concert, that she was "ashamed the President was from Texas".

Hmmm... They no longer got any radio air-play and ritualistic Dixie Chicks CD burnings became Bible-Belt happenings. Along with some death threats. The group stuck together and while raising kids and making music, this documentary was made.

After the movie, I'll be near the front row holding a Meet-Up sign and after we gather together, we will go to a local pub, which also has sandwiches and burgers on their menu.

I chose the 1:50 showtime over the 4:40 showtime so that people who have plans for Saturday night might be able to attend as well.

The obligatory review: http://www.msnbc.msn....
item.name: Dixie Chicks: Shut Up and Sing
